oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Uniform coat of Dr. Samuel Houston Caldwell, Surg. 21st Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This coat belonged to Dr. Samuel Houston Caldwell of Henry County, Tennessee. He served as the surgeon of the 46th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. Captured at Tiptonville, Tennessee, Caldwell received his parole in April 1862. In February 1864 he was appointed; surgeon of the 21st Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA and served on Gen. Forrest's staff until the end of the war. Made of jeans cloth, his coat is an excellent example of the the type worn by officers in the Western Theater of the Confederacy.
